description: Set to turn himself in to head to prison Monday morning, DeKalb County teen Yosif Elhmadi didn’t show, officials said.
title: DeKalb armed robber on the loose after getting 20-year sentence
title_page: DeKalb armed robber on the loose after getting 20-year sentence
text:
Set to turn himself in to head to prison Monday morning, DeKalb County teen Yosif Elhmadi didn’t show, officials said.
The 18-year-old is now wanted, the district attorney’s office confirmed. Elhmadi was sentenced to 20 years to serve 15 in prison after pleading guilty to charges of armed robbery and aggravated assault on March 20. Specific details on the crimes weren't immediately available.
He’d been out on $50,000 bond since October, according to jail records.
The court ordered him to turn himself in by 9 a.m. Monday. The judge on the case is J.P. Boulee, according to Channel 2 Action News.
He still hadn’t shortly after 4:30 p.m., according to authorities.
In other news:
Channel 2's Steve Gehlbach reports: Family searching for mother who disappeared in Gwinnett County
